primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the physical space of human suffering and 'hostage' conditions to personally deliver humanity from cosmic powers (Sin/Death) through the physical sacrifice of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God did not send the search and rescue team. In Jesus, God sent himself.
He goes alone... he is crushed by the steamrolling powers of darkness.
Only such a power... can overcome death and make enemies into friends.
How then should the scriptures be fulfilled...
The whole race of humankind is held hostage to sin and death.
Sharing the same bread, the same wine.
Jesus gets down on his knees... and washes the disciples’ feet.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, the Devil, and 'Virtual' detachment
tekstueel_bewijs: Steamrolling powers of darkness, malice, evil, violence, sin, death, and the devil.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral lapse but a state of being 'hostage' that requires a divine 'SWAT team' intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The formation of a new family/community that loves as Christ loved.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (The 'Family')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is an objective result of the primary program (soteriology). 'I am closer to you now' is an effect of the Eucharist.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God worked mighty signs and wonders.
He will not let us be his enemies.
Jesus put himself into the battle.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You made a very important commitment.

voorbeelden: This is my commandment, that you love one another.
God didn’t want Jesus to have a home page.
We cannot understand... unless we understand something of what the Bible teaches.
Only such a power... can overcome death.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) and the absolute 'Pouvoir' of God. It is a theology of rescue, not recruitment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Virtual' (Not-S1) to the 'Hostage' reality (S2), then to the 'Physical Sacrifice' (S1) which results in 'Deliverance' (Not-S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Real Presence' of Christ's body given for enemies.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin is described as a cosmic hostage situation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are defined by their inability and their status as 'enemies' who are nonetheless invited to the table.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You made a very important commitment when you decided to come.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God did not send the search and rescue team. In Jesus, God sent himself.
Asking nothing of you at all except that you come and join him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Israelites, Disciples) are used as examples of helplessness or enmity, not as moral models.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric focus is maintained: God acts over their heads.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shift from 'doing' to 'receiving'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Virtual' world to the 'Physical' cross to the 'Physical' Eucharist is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'commitment' to come to church and the 'nothing required' nature of the table.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He is crushed by the steamrolling powers... Only such a power... can overcome death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit works through images and thoughts to grant 'Savoir' (understanding) of the sacrifice.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; sin is a hostage-taker that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of all redemptive verbs. The 'Virtual' vs 'Real' dichotomy serves as a powerful semiotic tool to emphasize the Incarnation.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; appropriate for Maundy Thursday.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is sufficiently 'heavy' to necessitate a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's rescue) strictly precedes and enables Ethics (Family/Love).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching. Rutledge avoids the trap of 'virtual' moralism by grounding the sermon in the objective, physical act of God in Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Kosovo/Internet metaphors; semiotics shows these metaphors function to define the 'Opponent' as detachment and the 'Subject' as physical presence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the 1 Cor text; semiotics shows how the text's 'grammar' of betrayal/giving is mirrored in the sermon's structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Virtual' is not just a modern topic but a semiotic 'Opponent' to the 'Object' of Real Presence.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Hostage' metaphor to perfectly illustrate the human lack of 'Pouvoir-faire'.
